title: Shyvana's Dragon's Decent should completely push enemies to its landing location and then stun them
body:
I think the CC on Shyvana's ultimate is very underwhelming; all it does is displace targets caught by an inch and then fly over them. It has a minimal impact in teamfights especially since Shyvana, as a tank, is supposed to use it as an initiation. In addition, its slow and telegraphed, can also be very easily stopped with any CC mid-flight.

The fact that Shyvana has no CC anywhere else in her kit, and she's a tank, means that her ult has to feel pretty impactful. I believe giving her ultimate more powerful and impactful CC would be the right buff for her, since she's struggling a bit. It also is very thematically fitting.

Just add a QoL buff where enemies are knocked back all the way to the landing location instead of just by an inch, and then _probably_ add a mini stun like 0.75s afterwards. Thoughts?

The *consistent* knock-back distance would be nice. But the stun would be overkill.

Shyvana's big thing is that she's a ball of stats and pumps out a lot of **mixed damage** (AoE during ult - which is nearly always up), in addition to dealing %max health damage. She's already hard to build against and does her job exceedingly well. Adding more CC could break her.

Right now the meta just doesn't favor her. That's not indicative of her being strong or weak, there are just better picks at the *current time*.
Yeah I see why the stun would probably be overkill, but her ult at least needs an improvement to the feel of its knockback.

Shyvana has damage like bruisers and fighters not CC/utility like tanks
She's a tanky fighter. Tank is her secondary role, which generally translates to being a damage soak instead of having a lot of CC/utility.

Most of the power in her ult comes from the fact that it makes her tankier and makes all her normal abilities better.

If she was to have hard CC attached to the ult, then something else would have to be nerfed, either on her ult or somewhere else in her kit

Tanks don't do that sort of damage, they mostly provide CC. Fighters/bruisers do some pretty serious damage given how tanky they can build while doing it.

Jax is somewhat of a problem champion, where he has too much and thus has to be weak. Right now he isn't really that good because of the somewhat recent set of nerfs he's taken.

Shyvana is honestly stronger than him right now. As for damage, remember that her E synergizes stupidly well with her Q, and her W is pretty solid as well. Toss a BotRK on her and she's doing %health damage while she's doing %health damage (yo dawg, I heard you like..). She's an amazing duelist with pretty good damage.

She does lack CC, but tacking any on will likely make her too strong. What she could do with is making sure her ultimate always works. I know I've jumped through people and not damaged or knocked them back before.

I do admit that her ultimate's initial launch can feel a bit underwhelming, but it is important to remember that it gives her improved defensive steroids and increases the strength of all her other abilities, while also having a pretty low cooldown and a good duration.

The issue I have with Shyv is that she doesn't do her theme any justice. You hardly get to be in Dragon form because it dissipates too fast. Furthermore, it isn't classified as unstoppable when it really really needs to be. I can't imagine why Riot wouldn't give her this, they have no good reason not to.

Her ultimate's *minimum* duration is 20 seconds. 100 Fury, -5 per second, +2 per basic attack.

And if you use Q on a minion wave, you hit them all twice, which will extend her ultimate by 4 seconds on 5 targets.

Hypothetically (constantly basic attacking at max AS or with her Q), Shyvana can actually stay in dragon form indefinitely based on those numbers. Not a short duration by any stretch of the imagination.

If you consider that the improved basic abilities are a part of the ultimate then you realise it is very strong and impactful. While the initial jump may be weaker, overall is it a brilliant ability.
